S

searchStop - Variable in class ECAMspecific
A timeout variable for the search functions, in milliseconds
shuffleFactor(int[]) - Method in class Examples
Randomizes the factors from generalWolframCode(), normally handled through permutations and factoriadics, but the degree factorial algorithm, higher than 16! is instead randomized
singleBitField - Variable in class SwingOutputPanel
Array used with single bit initial input
singleBitImage - Variable in class SwingOutputPanel
Used to display an ECA with single bit initial input
singleBitInput(int[], int, int) - Method in class ECAMpostProcessing
Generates the standard binary additive Wolfram code calculation with single bit initial input using the given truth table
singleInit - Variable in class BasicECA
True means use single bit init input, false means use random input
specific - Variable in class ECAasMultiplication
Contains functions that search specific Wolfram codes for neighborhood permutation multiplication solutions
specificFactoradic(int, int) - Static method in class PermutationsFactoradic
Specific factoradic, typically for lengths of longer than 8 or 9, to save time and memory
specificPermutation(int, int) - Static method in class PermutationsFactoradic
Specific permutation of a given length, typically for lengths of longer than 8 or 9, to save time and memory
specificTable(int, int, int) - Method in class CayleyDickson
Returns a specific hypercomplex multiplication table
subsectionCoefficientMultiplication(ValidSolution, int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
This function gets a subset of the output data calculated in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), non-negative real
subsectionComplexField(ValidSolution, int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
Gets a rectangular subsection of the output from multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex
subsectionComplexFieldToBinary(int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
Takes the complex output of a solution, if the real and imaginary parts are negative, they become 1's in the output, if positive, 0.
subsectionComplexFieldToBinary(ValidSolution, int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
Takes the complex output of a solution, if the real and imaginary parts are negative, they become 1's in the output, if positive, 0.
subsectionComplexVectorField(ValidSolution, int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
Gets a rectangular subsection of the output from multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex vector, each unit vector is a column in the neighborhood after multiplication just before normalization
subsectionFactorLayers(ValidSolution, int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
This function transforms the output of a standard additive ECA calculation into the constituent binary factors of a solution from ECApathPermutations as layers
subsectionNeighborhoodFirst(ValidSolution, int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
Returns a subsection of the vector field calculated in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), it is the neighborhood polynomial results just prior to the neighborhood normalization and just after the geometric mean
subsectionVectorField(ValidSolution, int, int) - Method in class ECAMoutputSubsections
Returns a subsection of the vector field calculated in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), it is the neighborhood polynomial results just prior to the neighborhood normalization and just after the geometric mean
SwingBinaryFactorLayers - Class in Unnamed Package
Each cell's set of permuted neighborhoods as factors in Multiplications A, layer by layer, layer = numFactors is the result layer
SwingBinaryFactorLayers() - Constructor for class SwingBinaryFactorLayers
Initializes Swing components, has button action
SwingBinaryShadow - Class in Unnamed Package
The binary shadow is 2 planes, one is the real component of the output of a solution and the other is the imaginary component, the input is complex and the components get rounded, less than zero is 1 greater than zero is 0
SwingComplexLayers - Class in Unnamed Package
Multiplications B, complex, just prior to normalization is a neighborhood of complex data than can be interpreted as a components of a vector for that cell
SwingComplexOutput - Class in Unnamed Package
Multiplications B and C output, seperately
SwingDashboard - Class in Unnamed Package
GUI control panel, manages the other Swing classes, there is no algorithm logic in the GUI components, that is all in ECAasMultiplication.
SwingDashboard() - Constructor for class SwingDashboard
Contains all the Java Swing component initialization and function-calling logic
SwingLayers - Class in Unnamed Package
Displays the binary neighborhoods as binary factor layers, displays the non-negative real version of Multiplications B
SwingLayers(ECAasMultiplication) - Constructor for class SwingLayers
Initializes Swing components
SwingOutputPanel - Class in Unnamed Package
Displays the standard additive binary Wolfram code output for single bit and random initial input, as well as non-negative real input
SwingPolyTest - Class in Unnamed Package
Multiplications B, displays results of the non-negative real output processed with the polynomial from generatePolynomial() rather than multiplying out the whole numFactors-dim partial product table, verifies generatePolynomial()
SwingPolyTest() - Constructor for class SwingPolyTest
Initializes a Swing JFrame to put this JPanel on
SwingTextPanel - Class in Unnamed Package
Swing text output in a form copyable to a clipboard, JARs don't have a default console to output text to
SwingTextPanel(ECAasMultiplication) - Constructor for class SwingTextPanel
